metadata.title: CVE-2021-1765 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
This issue was addressed with improved iframe sandbox enforcement. Thisissue is fixed in macOS Big Sur 11.2, Security Update 2021-001 Catalina,Security Update 2021-001 Mojave. Maliciously crafted web content mayviolate iframe sandboxing policy.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-1765` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.32.0-1ubuntu3
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.1 - 2.32.0-1ubuntu3
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-6.0 - 2.32.0-1ubuntu3
gir1.2-webkit-6.0 - 2.32.0-1ubuntu3
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.32.0-1ubuntu3
gir1.2-webkit2-4.1 - 2.32.0-1ubuntu3
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.32.0-1ubuntu3
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.32.0-1ubuntu3
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.1-0 - 2.32.0-1ubuntu3
libjavascriptcoregtk-6.0-1 - 2.32.0-1ubuntu3
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.32.0-1ubuntu3
libwebkit2gtk-4.1-0 - 2.32.0-1ubuntu3
libwebkitgtk-6.0-4 - 2.32.0-1ubuntu3
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.32.0-1ubuntu3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkit2gtk package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.32.0-1ubuntu3').
qtwebkit-opensource-src package in noble is affected and may need fixing.
